caption.title: A clustered AF organization increases IAV binding probability.
caption.p: To estimate the effect of AF clustering on the efficiency of a virus to bind the target cell, we simulated two scenarios in a 1x1 Î¼m membrane area, ( A) a varying cluster size and ( B) a varying degree of clustering. For A, we simulated a constant lateral concentration of AF (black) and added AF clusters (blue) at increasing size. In B, we keep the total amount of AF constant and gradually shift molecules into clusters. In both cases, an approaching virus was simulated as a 2D projection of a small spherical IAV particle (contact area as red circles in A and B). A binding attempt was counted as successful if at least 10 AF molecules were found inside the contact area. C and D show the simulation result plotted as the binding probability out of 1000 simulations against the respective tested cluster parameter.
